text: Judah’s Song of Praise
On that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah:
“⸤We have a strong city⸥;\f + \fr 26:1 \ft Literally “a city of strength for us” \f*
he sets up victory \add like\add* walls and ramparts!\f + \fr 26:1 \ft Hebrew “rampart” \f*
Open \add the\add* gates ⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 26:2 \ft Or “and” \f* \add the\add* righteous nation who keeps faithfulness may enter!
You will protect a firm inclination \add in\add* peace,
\add in\add* peace because he trusts in you.
Trust in Yahweh forever,
for in Yah, Yahweh \add you have\add* an everlasting rock.
For he has thrown down \add the\add* inhabitants of \add the\add* height,
he lays low \add the\add* lofty city.
He lays it low to \add the\add* ground;
he throws her to \add the\add* dust.
\add The\add* foot tramples it,
\add the\add* feet of \add the\add* poor, \add the\add* steps of \add the\add* needy.”
Yahweh’s People Vindicated
\add The\add* way of the righteous \add is\add* a straight path;
⸤you clear the level path of the righteous⸥.\f + \fr 26:7 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft level path of the righteous you make level”; the meaning of this phrase is uncertain \f*
Surely we wait for you \add in\add* the path of your judgments, Yahweh,
for your name and renown \add are the\add* desire of \add the\add* soul.
I desire you \add with all\add* my soul in the night;
also I seek you \add with\add* my spirit within me,
for when your judgments \add are\add* ⸤upon⸥\f + \fr 26:9 \ft Literally “to” \f* the earth,
\add the\add* inhabitants of \add the\add* world learn righteousness.
\add Though the\add* wicked person is shown compassion, he does not learn righteousness;
he acts unjustly in \add the\add* land \add of\add* uprightness,
and he does not see the majesty of Yahweh.
Yahweh, \add though\add* your hand reaches high, they do not see \add it\add*.
Let them see, and let them be ashamed of \add the\add* zeal of people.
Indeed, let the fire of your enemies consume them.
Yahweh, you will establish peace for us,
for you have done even all of our works for us.
Yahweh, our God, lords besides you ruled over us,
⸤but we praise your name alone⸥.\f + \fr 26:13 \ft Literally “alone in you we praise name you” \f*
\add The\add* dead do not live;
dead spirits do not rise
because you have punished and destroyed them,
and you have destroyed all memory of them.
You have added to the nation, Yahweh.
You have added to the nation; you are honored.
You have extended all \add the\add* ends of \add the\add* land.
Yahweh, in distress they have visited you;
they poured out an ⸤incantation⸥;\f + \fr 26:16 \ft Literally “whispering” \f*
your discipline \add was\add* on them.
Like \add a\add* pregnant woman on the point of giving birth, she writhes;
she cries in her labor pains.
So we were because of your presence, Yahweh.
We became pregnant, we writhed;
we gave birth \add to\add* wind.
We cannot bring about deliverance \add on the\add* earth,
and no inhabitants of \add the\add* world are born.

Your dead shall live; ⸤their corpses⸥\f + \fr 26:19 \ft Literally “my corpse;” some manuscripts propose an emendation to the suffix to change it to third person masculine plural (“their corpses”), which makes better sense \f* shall rise.
Wake up and sing for joy, dwellers of \add the\add* dust,
for your dew \add is\add* ⸤celestial dew⸥,\f + \fr 26:19 \ft Literally “dew of light” \f*
and the earth will give birth to dead spirits.\f + \fr 26:19 \ft Or “you make the land of Rephaim fall” \f*
Go, my people, enter into your chambers
and shut your doors\f + \fr 26:20 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) is singular \f* behind you;
hide for ⸤a very little⸥\f + \fr 26:20 \ft Literally “a little a little” \f* while,
until \add the\add* wrath has passed over.
For look! Yahweh \add is\add* about to come out from his place
to punish the iniquity of the inhabitants\f + \fr 26:21 \ft Hebrew “inhabitant” \f* of the earth against him,
and the earth will disclose her blood
and will no longer cover her slain.
